alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN ROOSEVELT, SOUTHEASTERN DE BACA AND NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM MDT... At 943 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles north of Elida to 17 miles northeast of Mesa. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elida, Dora and Kenna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; Roosevelt County
